text: Generating strings from (for example) lowercase characters:

code:
import random, string

def randomword(length):
   return ''.join(random.choice(string.lowercase) for i in range(length))

# Created by throwing my keyboard against wall.  Guaranteed to be random
random_string = "t\b2w57,owe1v5h"

text: Since this question is fairly, uh, random, this may work for you:
You can build random ascii characters like:
And then build up a longer string like:

code:
len = 50
print ''.join( [chr(random.randint(0,255)) for i in xrange(0,len)] )

text: You haven't really said much about what sort of random string you need.
But in any case, you should look into the random module.
A very simple solution is pasted below.

code:
import random

def randstring(length=10):
    valid_letters='ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ'
    return ''.join((random.choice(valid_letters) for i in xrange(length)))

print randstring()
print randstring(20)

text: Here is a recipe to create a random string (password) which is readable.
there is another question on this at http://stackoverflow.com/questions/785058/random-strings-in-python-2-6-is-this-ok
